content: to the front of the work it will make it easier to drop the stitches if all of the beads are seated the same way in the work if you aren t planning to drop all of the purl stitches feel free to place beads with a crochet hook on the purl columns that are not being dropped pattern cast on 4 stitches row 1 kfb k3 row 2 and all even row k3 purl to end row 3 kfb k4 row 5 kfb k5 row 7 kfb k6 row 9 kfb k7 row 11 kfb yo ssk k6 row 13 kfb b p1 b k6 row 15 kfb k1 b p1 b k6 row 17 kfb k2 b p1 b k6 row 19 kfb k3 b p1 b k6 row 21 kfb k4 b p1 b k6 row 23 kfb yo ssk k3 b p1 b k6 row 25 kfb b p1 b k3 b p1 b k6 row 27 kfb k1 b p1 b k3 b p1 b k6 row 29 kfb k2 b p1 b k3 b p1 b k6 row 31 kfb k3 b p1 b k3 b p1 b k6 row 33 kfb k4 b p1 b k3 b p1 b k6 row 35 kfb yo ssk k3 b p1 b twice k6 row 37 kfb b p1 b k3 b p1 b twice k6 row 39 kfb k1 b p1 b k3 b p1 b twice k6 row 41 kfb k2 b p1 b k3 b p1 b twice k6 row 43 kfb k3 b p1 b k3 b p1 b twice k6 row 45 kfb k4 b p1 b k3 b p1 b twice k6 continue repeating row 35 thru 45 adding in an additional repeat of k3 b p1 b per set do not put beads into final row of body pattern when shawl reaches desired length bind off as follows bind off first 6 stitches in a standard bind-off knit 2 stitches pass the right stitch over the left stitch on right hand needle knit next stitch and repeat passing over sequence drop the purl stitch blue on chart and unravel the first couple of stitches pick up the top strand of yarn with the left needle from front to back and then knit it through the back loop continue standard bind-off until the next purl stitch and repeat the dropping of stitches and knitting through top strand go back and finish unraveling all the dropped stitches if you do not want to drop all of the droppable purl stitches just bind off the purl stitches as a normal knit stitch
